The story follows Detective David Mullen (portrayed by Don McKellar)), now working for the New York City Police Department (NYPD P.D.), as he investigates the murder of a young woman named Emily Davis (portrayed by Amy Ryan)).
Emily was found in her apartment building, along with a note that read "I'm sorry for what I've done. You have my heartfelt apology. I hope you can forgive me. Sincerely, Emily Davis.".
The police investigation into the murder of Emily Davis uncovers some unexpected connections and clues to the identity of the murderer.
Detective Mullen begins to piece together a timeline and sequence of events that occurred leading up to the murder of Emily Davis.
He discovers that Emily had been seeing someone named Michael Johnson (portrayed by Jack Johnson)), who is suspected of being involved in the murder of Emily Davis.
Detective Mullen also discovers that Emily had been taking some medication prescribed by her doctor, Dr. David Greenberg (portrayed by Don McKellar)), which may have contributed to her state of mind at the time of her murder.
